p: The National Public Health Emergency Team (NPHET) has made several amendments to the Health Protection Surveillance Centre (HPSC) guidance on the use of surgical masks on 22 April 2020, in accordance with the COVID-19 outbreak [ 45]. These include hand hygiene and maintaining social distancing of 2 m between individuals. Masks should be worn covering the nose and mouth, by holding only elastic tie bands. Once the masks are worn, it is not recommended to move them up and down over the nose and mouth. Furthermore, safe disposal and removal of masks should also be practised [ 46].
